summary:
Dionysus was an important god in ancient Greek mythology. He was associated with wine, parties, and theatre. People believed he could make them feel happy and free from worries. Dionysus was also linked to nature, growth, and even the underworld.

He was known by different names, like Bacchus, and his origins are a bit mysterious. His cults were popular but sometimes seen as dangerous by authorities due to their wild nature. Dionysus' festivals included plays and rituals, influencing the start of Western theatre.
title: Dionysus
